documents.title: Medicare Savings Programs Eligibility Guidelines - California
documents.content:
Income limits for Medicare Savings Programs in California for 2024:
1. QMB (Qualified Medicare Beneficiary): Individual monthly income limit $1,235; Couple $1,663
2. SLMB (Specified Low-Income Medicare Beneficiary): Individual monthly income limit $1,478; Couple $1,992
3. QI (Qualifying Individual): Individual monthly income limit $1,660; Couple $2,239

Asset limits apply to all programs:
- Individual: $9,090
- Couple: $13,630

sections.title: Income Limits
sections.content: QMB, SLMB, and QI programs have different income thresholds...

documents.title: Federal Guidelines for Dual Eligible Beneficiaries
documents.content:
Dual eligibility requirements:
1. Must qualify for Medicare (age 65+ or certain disabilities)
2. Must meet state Medicaid eligibility criteria
3. Income must be at or below 135% Federal Poverty Level
4. Must be U.S. citizen or legal resident

Application process requires:
- Proof of Medicare eligibility
- Income verification
- Asset documentation
- State residency proof

sections.title: Basic Requirements
sections.content: Core eligibility criteria for dual status...

documents.title: Medicare Savings Program Application Process - California
documents.content:
Application Steps for Medicare Savings Programs:
1. Initial Screening (1-2 days)
   - Verify Medicare enrollment
   - Check income eligibility
   - Review asset documentation

2. Documentation Collection (3-5 days)
   - Recent income statements
   - Bank statements
   - Property records
   - Medicare card copy

3. Application Submission (1-2 weeks)
   - Complete state application form
   - Submit supporting documents
   - Sign required declarations

4. Processing Period (2-3 weeks)
   - Application review
   - Eligibility determination
   - Notification of decision

documents.title: California Dual Eligible Program Guidelines
documents.content:
California-specific requirements for dual eligibility:
1. State residency verification required
2. Medi-Cal income limits apply
3. Asset documentation must be current (within 30 days)
4. Annual renewal process required

Special Provisions:
- Retroactive coverage available (up to 3 months)
- Expedited processing for certain medical conditions
- Appeal rights within 60 days of determination
